ARABIC: وَلَا يَمْلِكُ ٱلَّذِينَ يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِ ٱلشَّفَٰعَةَ إِلَّا مَن شَهِدَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَهُمْ يَعْلَمُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Those you call upon apart from Him possess no power of intercession - only those who bore witness to the truth and have full knowledge.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Those they invoke apart from Him have no power of intercession, except those who testify to the truth and have knowledge.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Those whom they call upon, instead of Allah have no power of intercession, except such that testify to the truth based on knowledge.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Those whom they worship besides God are not able to intercede, except for those among them who believe in the Truth (God) and who know whom to intercede for.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And those whom they worship besides Allah do not have the right of intercession – the right of intercession is only for those who testify to the Truth and have knowledge.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And those whom they invoke instead of Him have no power of intercession -- except for those who bear witness to the truth knowingly, and they know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And those whom they call upon besides Him have no authority for intercession, but he who bears witness of the truth and they know (him).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Those they call upon, apart from Him, have no power of intercession, save such as have testified to the truth, and that knowingly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And those unto whom they cry instead of Him possess no power of intercession, saving him who beareth witness unto the Truth knowingly.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Those whom they invoke besides God have no power of intercession, only those who bear witness to the truth and they know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And those whom they call upon beside Him own not the power of intercession save those who have borne witness to the truth and who know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Those whom they invoke besides Him have no power of intercession, except those who are witness to the truth and who know [for whom to intercede].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And those whom they invoke besides Allah have no power of intercession;- only he who bears witness to the Truth, and they know (him).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And those whom they invoke instead of Him have no power of intercession; except those who bear witness to the truth (i.e. believed in the Oneness of Allah, and obeyed His Orders), and they know (the facts about the Oneness of Allah).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Those whom they call upon, other than Him, have no power to intercede (for them), except those that have knowingly borne witness to the truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Those they invoke besides Him are incapable of intercession; only those who testify to the truth and have knowledge.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And those they invoke besides Him do not possess [power of] intercession; but only those who testify to the truth [can benefit], and they know.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [43:86] And those whom they, the disbelievers, call on, [those whom] they worship, besides Him, that is, besides God, have no power of intercession, for anyone, except those who bear witness to the truth, that is, those who say ‘there is no god except God’, with [full] knowledge, in their hearts of what they have testified to with their tongues — such are Jesus, Ezra, and the angels, who will intercede for believers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And those unto whom they cry) those whom they worship (instead of Him possess no power of intercession) He says: the angels have no power to intercede in favour of anybody, (saving him who beareth witness unto the Truth) the testification that there is no deity save Allah, sincerely believing in it (knowingly) knowing deep in their hearts it is the Truth. This was revealed about the Banu Malih who claimed the angels were the daughters of Allah.
